description: The handshake protocol in Object Management Group (OMG) DDS Security 1.1 sends cleartext information about all of the capabilities of a participant (including capabilities inapplicable to the current session), which makes it easier for attackers to discover potentially sensitive reachability informa
cause: The handshake protocol in OMG DDS Security 1.1 sends cleartext information about all participant capabilities, including those irrelevant to the current session.
impact: Attackers can easily discover sensitive reachability information.

description: The Access Control plugin in eProsima Fast RTPS through 1.9.0 does not check partition permissions from remote participant connections, which can lead to policy bypass for a secure Data Distribution Service (DDS) partition.
cause: The Access Control plugin in eProsima Fast RTPS does not check partition permissions from remote participant connections.
impact: Policy bypass for a secure Data Distribution Service (DDS) partition.
description_without_punct: the access control plugin in eprosima fast rtps through 190 does not check partition permissions from remote participant connections which can lead to policy bypass for a secure data distribution service dds partition
description_normalized: The Access Control plugin in eProsima Fast RTPS through 1.9.0 does not check partition permissions from remote participant connections, which can lead to policy bypass for a secure Data Distribution Service (DDS) partition.

description: The Access Control plugin in eProsima Fast RTPS through 1.9.0 allows fnmatch pattern matches with topic name strings (instead of the permission expressions themselves), which can lead to unintended connections between participants in a Data Distribution Service (DDS) network.
cause: The Access Control plugin in eProsima Fast RTPS uses fnmatch pattern matching on topic name strings for access control instead of using permission expressions. This allows attackers to craft topic names that match unintended permission patterns, bypassing the intended access control.
impact: Unintended connections between participants in a Data Distribution Service (DDS) network, potentially leading to data breaches or denial-of-service attacks.
description_without_punct: the access control plugin in eprosima fast rtps through 190 allows fnmatch pattern matches with topic name strings instead of the permission expressions themselves which can lead to unintended connections between participants in a data distribution service dds network
description_normalized: The Access Control plugin in eProsima Fast RTPS through 1.9.0 allows fnmatch pattern matches with topic name strings (instead of the permission expressions themselves), which can lead to unintended connections between participants in a Data Distribution Service (DDS) network.

description: OpenDDS is an open source C++ implementation of the Object Management Group (OMG) Data Distribution Service (DDS). OpenDDS applications that are exposed to untrusted RTPS network traffic may crash when parsing badly-formed input. This issue has been patched in version 3.23.1.
cwe_explanation: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
cause: Parsing badly-formed RTPS network input.
impact: OpenDDS applications may crash.
description_without_punct: opendds is an open source c implementation of the object management group omg data distribution service dds opendds applications that are exposed to untrusted rtps network traffic may crash when parsing badlyformed input this issue has been patched in version 3231
description_normalized: OpenDDS is an open source C++ implementation of the Object Management Group (OMG) Data Distribution Service (DDS). OpenDDS applications that are exposed to untrusted RTPS network traffic may crash when parsing badly-formed input. This issue has been patched in version 3.23.1.
explanation: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

description: OpenDDS is an open source C++ implementation of the Object Management Group (OMG) Data Distribution Service (DDS). OpenDDS crashes while parsing a malformed `PID_PROPERTY_LIST` in a DATA submessage during participant discovery. Attackers can remotely crash OpenDDS processes by sending a DATA submess
cwe_explanation: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
cause: OpenDDS crashes due to improper handling of a malformed `PID_PROPERTY_LIST` in a DATA submessage during participant discovery.  The parser does not correctly handle malformed input, leading to a buffer overflow or similar memory corruption.
impact: Remote attackers can crash OpenDDS processes by sending a crafted DATA submessage, resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS) attack.
description_without_punct: opendds is an open source c implementation of the object management group omg data distribution service dds opendds crashes while parsing a malformed pid_property_list in a data submessage during participant discovery attackers can remotely crash opendds processes by sending a data submess
description_normalized: OpenDDS is an open source C++ implementation of the Object Management Group (OMG) Data Distribution Service (DDS). OpenDDS crashes while parsing a malformed `PID_PROPERTY_LIST` in a DATA submessage during participant discovery. Attackers can remotely crash OpenDDS processes by sending a DATA submess
explanation: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

description: eprosima Fast DDS is a C++ implementation of the Data Distribution Service standard of the Object Management Group. Prior to versions 2.10.0, 2.9.2, and 2.6.5, a malformed GAP submessage can trigger assertion failure, crashing FastDDS. Version 2.10.0, 2.9.2, and 2.6.5 contain a patch for this issue.
cause: A malformed GAP submessage is not properly handled, leading to an assertion failure.
impact: Crashing of the Fast DDS application.

description: An issue in the HistoryQosPolicy component of FastDDS v2.12.x, v2.11.x, v2.10.x, and v2.6.x leads to a SIGABRT (signal abort) upon receiving DataWriter's data.
cause: A flaw in the HistoryQosPolicy component of FastDDS causes a NULL pointer dereference when processing data from a DataWriter.
impact: A SIGABRT (signal abort) leading to application crash.

description: An issue was discovered in eProsima FastDDS v.2.14.0 and before, allows a local attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) and obtain sensitive information via a crafted max_samples parameter in DurabilityService QoS component.
cwe_explanation: Use of a hardcoded value that leads to unintended behavior, such as Denial of Service (DoS) or information disclosure.
cause: A crafted `max_samples` parameter in the DurabilityService QoS component.
impact: Denial of service (DoS) and potential sensitive information disclosure.

description: An issue was discovered in eProsima FastDDS v.2.14.0 and before, allows a local attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) and obtain sensitive information via a crafted history_depth parameter in DurabilityService QoS component.
cause: A crafted `history_depth` parameter in the DurabilityService QoS component is not properly validated.
impact: Denial of service (DoS) and potential sensitive information disclosure.

description: FastDDS is a C++ implementation of the DDS (Data Distribution Service) standard of the OMG (Object Management Group). description: RTI Connext DDS Professional and Connext DDS Secure Versions 4.2.x to 6.1.0 are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, which may allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code.
cwe_explanation: Out-of-bounds write that leads to buffer overflow vulnerability.
cause: Stack-based buffer overflow in RTI Connext DDS Professional and Connext DDS Secure versions 4.2.x to 6.1.0.
impact: Local attacker may execute arbitrary code.

description: RTI Connext DDS Professional and Connext DDS Secure Versions 4.2x to 6.1.0 vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, which may allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code.
cwe_explanation: Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability, where writing data past the allocated buffer on the stack can overwrite adjacent memory, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.
cause: A flaw in the code's handling of data input allows an attacker to write beyond the allocated buffer on the stack.
impact: A local attacker could execute arbitrary code, potentially compromising the system.

description: Open redirect vulnerability in DDSN Interactive cm3 Acora CMS 6.0.6/1a, 6.0.2/1a, 5.5.7/12b, 5.5.0/1b-p1, and possibly other versions allows remote attackers to redirect users to arbitrary web sites and conduct phishing attacks via a URL in the l parameter to track.aspx.
cwe_explanation: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
cause: Lack of proper validation and sanitization of the 'l' parameter in the 'track.aspx' URL.
impact: Remote attackers can redirect users to arbitrary websites, enabling phishing attacks.
description_without_punct: open redirect vulnerability in ddsn interactive cm3 acora cms 6061a 6021a 55712b 5501bp1 and possibly other versions allows remote attackers to redirect users to arbitrary web sites and conduct phishing attacks via a url in the l parameter to trackaspx

explanation: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

description: A code execution vulnerability exists in the DDS scanline parsing functionality of OpenImageIO Project OpenImageIO v2.4.4.2. A specially-crafted .dds can lead to a heap buffer overflow. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.
cause: A specially-crafted .dds file triggers a heap buffer overflow in the DDS scanline parsing functionality.
impact: Code execution

description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in the DDS native tile reading functionality of OpenImageIO Project OpenImageIO v2.3.19.0 and v2.4.4.2. A specially-crafted .dds can lead to denial of service. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.
cause: A specially-crafted .dds file causes uncontrolled resource consumption in the DDS native tile reading functionality.
impact: Denial of service (DoS).

description: GIMP DDS File Parsing Heap-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of GIMP. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or o
cwe_explanation: Classic buffer overflow vulnerability where writing data beyond the allocated buffer size can overwrite adjacent memory areas leading to unexpected behavior or crashes, and potentially arbitrary code execution.

impact: Remote code execution on affected GIMP installations.  Successful exploitation allows attackers to execute arbitrary code.

description: A stack buffer overflow in /ddsi/q_bitset.h of Eclipse IOT Cyclone DDS Project v0.1.0 causes the DDS subscriber server to crash.
cwe_explanation: Out-of-bounds write vulnerability that occurs when a program attempts to write data beyond the allocated buffer in the stack.

impact: Causes the DDS subscriber server to crash.

description: A heap buffer overflow in /src/dds_stream.c of Eclipse IOT Cyclone DDS Project v0.1.0 causes the DDS subscriber server to crash.
cwe_explanation: Buffer Overflow Vulnerability:  This CWE describes vulnerabilities where a program attempts to write data beyond the allocated buffer size, potentially overwriting adjacent memory regions. This often leads to crashes or arbitrary code execution.
cause: A heap buffer overflow in the /src/dds_stream.c file of the Eclipse IOT Cyclone DDS Project v0.1.0.
impact: Causes the DDS subscriber server to crash.
